titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:13:47 +0000.

did.abstract: A typewritten teleplay for an episode of the television series Brooklyn Bridge, dated 1991. Brooklyn Bridge aired on the CBS network from 1991 to 1993. The series depicted a Jewish family living in Brooklyn during the mid-1950s. The teleplay is for an episode titled, When Irish Eyes Are Smiling. Included with the teleplay is a clipping of an article about the series from the New York Times, dated 1991.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Bridge teleplay, 1991.001, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The teleplay, whether in whole or in part, may not be edited, duplicated, loaned, assigned, disposed of or transfered to any other person, firm, corporation or entity, nor may it be published, performed or used in any other manner or for any other purpose whatsoever.
